fn.p: Abbreviations: BIA = bioelectrical impedance analysis, CK-MB = creatine kinase-myocardial band, CRP = C-reactive protein, CSA = cross-sectional area, ELISA = enzyme-linked immunosorbent assays, EORTC QLQ-C30 = European Organization for the Research and Treatment of Cancer, HAD = 3-hydroxyacyl-CoA-dehydrogenase, IFN-γ = interferon gamma, IL-6, IL-15, IL-8, IL-10, IL-1β = interleukin- 6,15,8, 10 and 1beta, MFI = multidimensional fatigue inventory, mTOR = mechanistic target of rapamycin, p62 = ubiquitin-binding protein p62, QLQ-BR25 = The European organization for research and treatment of cancer quality, of life questionnaire, Quality of Life Questionnaire Core 30, RT = resistance training, SC = satellite cell, SPARC = secreted protein acidic and rich in cysteine (osteonectin), SWA = sensewear armband, TNF-α = tumor necrosis factor alpha, TWEAK = TNF-related weak inducer of apoptosis, VO 2max = maximal oxygen uptake.

How to cite this article: Strandberg E, Vassbakk-Svindland K, Henriksson A, Johansson B, Vikmoen O, Kudrén D, Schauer T, Lindman H, Wärnberg F, Berntsen S, Demmelmaier I, Nordin K, Raastad T. Effects of heavy-load resistance training during (neo-)adjuvant chemotherapy on muscle cellular outcomes in women with breast cancer. Medicine. 2021;100:10(e24960).

This study is supported by the Swedish Cancer Society (18–0356) and Kreftforeningen (198149–2018), Norway. The funders will not have a role in the study design, execution, analyses, interpretation of the data, or the decision to submit results.
The authors have no conflicts of interests to disclose.
The datasets generated during and/or analyzed during the current study are available from the corresponding author on reasonable request.
